column2: in vānum labōrāvērunt quī aedificant eam. Nisi Dominus custōdīverit cīvitātem
column3: frūstrā vigilat quī custōdit eam. ^ Unless the Lord build the house
column4: they labour in vain that build it. Unless the Lord keep the city
column5: he watcheth in vain that keepeth it.

column1: 2 ^ Vānum est vōbīs ante lūcem surgere
column3: quī mandūcātis pānem dolōris. Quum dederit dīlectīs suīs somnum. ^ It is vain for you to rise before light
column4: rise ye after you have sat down
column5: you that eat the bread of sorrow. When he shall give sleep to his beloved.

column2: fructus ventris. ^ Behold the inheritance of the Lord are children; the reward
ita fīliī excussōrum. ^ As arrows in the hand of the mighty
column3: so the children of them that have been shaken.

column1: 5 ^ Beātus vir quī implēvit dēsīderium suum ex ipsīs; nōn confundētur quum loquētur inimīcīs suīs in portā. ^ Blessed is the man that hath filled the desire with them; he shall not be confounded when he shall speak to his enemies in the gate.
